Ad Text:
Initial 12 month contract + possible extension
Brisbane (Kelvin Grove)
Hybrid and flexible working available

In collaboration with a leading Higher Education provider, Emanate Technology is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to lead the translation of business needs into practical, high-value solutions that deliver meaningful outcomes.

You’ll sit at the heart of complex initiatives, bridging business and technology, shaping requirements, improving processes and supporting delivery from discovery through to implementation.

What you’ll be doing
Scoping business needs and objectives with diverse stakeholder groups
Eliciting functional and non-functional requirements, user stories and use cases
Translating business requirements into clear, fit-for-purpose analysis artefacts
Analysing data sets to uncover insights and inform decision making
Mapping current and future state processes using BPMN standards
Identifying process inefficiencies and recommending improvement opportunities
Facilitating workshops using design and systems thinking techniques
Liaising between business stakeholders and technical delivery teams
Collaborating with project teams to align process change with technology uplift
Producing clear reports and presentations for executive audiences
Monitoring benefits realisation and recommending ongoing improvements
Supporting testing, validation, training and implementation activities

What you need to bring
Proven experience delivering complex initiatives as a Business Analyst
Demonstrated experience collaborating with senior stakeholders to elicit requirements
Extensive experience applying business analysis techniques and frameworks
Strong experience developing process maps, data models and system documentation
Established experience driving continuous improvement and meaningful change
High-level experience producing clear specifications, reports and presentations
Sound experience building productive, outcomes-focused working relationships
Solid experience working independently and as part of multi-disciplinary teams

Bonus points for…
Previous experience delivering solutions within government or higher education
Hands-on experience implementing SaaS or COTS platforms
Practical experience applying AI technologies or tools in business solutions

For a confidential discussion, or for more information please contact Amy Watson on amy@emanatetechnology.com.au.

Job Title: Senior Manager - Reward, HR Technology and Insights
Ad Text:
Perth Airport is Australia’s Western Hub connecting the people, businesses and communities of Western Australia with the rest of Australia and the world. Operating 24 hours a day, seven days a week throughout the year, Perth Airport plays a significant role in providing economic, social and cultural benefits to West Australians. 

Perth Airport is investing more than $5 billion in new infrastructure so we can support our airline partners to grow, offering more services to new destinations and an improved customer experience. This will be the largest funded private equity build in Western Australia for the last 30 years. 

Over the coming decade we will expand T1 International, and build new domestic terminal facilities, a parallel runway, two multi-storey carparks and our first airport hotel. This will deliver one airport for the people of Western Australia which will host all flight services in a central location giving passengers a seamless, world-class travel experience. 

The Perth Airport estate is spread over 2100 hectares and has developed a $1.5 billion portfolio of existing industrial premises and significant vacant land holdings. 

We service a truly diverse community and play an important role in strengthening cultural, family and social bonds while supporting business, tourism and leisure travel. 

About the role 

This is not just any HR role, it’s a strategic leadership opportunity to transform systems, elevate performance, and deliver insights that shape business decisions at the highest level. If you are passionate about driving organisational success through people, this is your chance to make a lasting impact. 

As Senior Manager - Reward, HR Technology & Insights, you will lead a team of experts across remuneration, systems, analytics, and core HR processes. Ensuring Perth Airport remains competitive and future ready, your performance areas span strategic design, operational excellence, and governance inclusive of: 

Strategic Leadership: Inspire and develop a high-performing team of subject matter experts, fostering collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement.
Reward & Remuneration: Architect competitive remuneration frameworks, incentive programs, and embed gender equity principles in all practices.
HR Season Management: Oversee critical annual cycles - FTE budgeting, performance reviews, salary adjustments, and incentive payments ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
Data & Insights: Drive optimisation of HR systems including the implementation of a new Human Capital Management System, deliver actionable analytics, and empower leaders with insights for informed decision-making.
Governance & Reporting: Prepare board and committee papers, manage compliance, and oversee internal and external reporting requirements. 

About you 

Tertiary qualification in HR Management, Data Science, or related discipline.
7 to 10 years of leadership experience in complex, multidisciplinary environments.
Expertise in remuneration strategy, HR systems, and data analytics.
Proven ability to influence senior stakeholders and deliver strategic outcomes.
Strong understanding of modern HRIS systems and change management practices.

 About Us 

We offer a dynamic and supportive team culture, a contemporary workplace with great facilities and a modern approach to work/life integration. Our competitive remuneration package comes with additional company benefits including free parking. 

Perth Airport is an Equal Opportunities Employer. We are committed to building an equitable and diverse workforce representative of the community we serve. We encourage and welcome applications from all communities and backgrounds. 

Doing the right thing by the planet and future generations is important to us. At PAPL we place a strong emphasis on embedding sustainability throughout our business strategy and operations. We remain steadfast in our commitment to driving ESPG (Environmental, Social, People, Governance) performance across our value chain and areas that have material environmental and social impact. 

If this sounds like you, please get in touch.

Description
Play a key role in transforming how we use data science, machine learning and AI to drive smarter, faster, and more impactful decisions. You will have the opportunity to build intimate knowledge of the best data asset in the Australian media landscape. 


At the Foxtel Group, we're reimagining the role of data and AI in the media industry. With executive-level sponsorship for innovation and access to a rich data ecosystem, we're building a future where AI delivers tangible and measurable commercial value. 


We’re looking for a AI Specialist to join our Subscriber Revenue team. This is a rare opportunity to work with our unique content viewing datasets spanning over 5 million subscribers, and use it to shape how content and pricing strategies are crafted across Sport, Entertainment, and News. 


Key Responsibilities
Use Foxtel Group’s proprietary data, machine learning and AI frameworks to optimise content investment and subscriber pricing strategies. 
Translate complex audience, loyalty, and content-viewing data into commercially impactful decisions. 
Design and implement robust machine learning and AI solutions that unlock new value streams. 
Partner closely with stakeholders to demonstrate the impact of analytics, selecting the right metrics, applying A/B testing, and leveraging experimental design. 
Champion evidence-based decision-making, sharing insights and helping to embed AI best practices across the business. 
Inform Foxtel’s broader AI strategy through market research, a deep understanding of industry trends, and a network of technical advisors. 


About your experience
A PhD in Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Physics, Actuarial Studies, Computer Science, Economics, or another related quantitative field (preferred). 
Substantial hands-on experience as a Data Scientist in a large, complex business environment, ideally one that deals with audience, customer, or loyalty data. 
A proven track record of delivering data science solutions that drive material commercial outcomes. 
Demonstrated expertise in applying statistical modelling, experimental design, and performance measurement techniques to solve business problems. 
Deep experience designing, engineering, and deploying production-ready AI/ML models. 
Ability to bridge complex statistical methods with tangible business value. 
Proficiency in Python or R, strong SQL skills, and familiarity with BI tools such as Looker or Tableau. 
A forward-thinking, collaborative mindset with a passion for applying AI in real-world, high-impact scenarios. 
We appreciate your interest in this role and thank you for your application. Please note that due to the upcoming holiday period, we will commence reviewing applications in early January 2026.






Life at Foxtel Group 
A career with us means working across one or more of our brands including Foxtel, Hubbl, Kayo Sports, BINGE, Flash, Fox Sports and Foxtel Media. When you join, the Perks at Work are taken care of:  
You’re part of Fox Flex, our hybrid way of working with time spent at home and on campus  
Free & discounted products including Foxtel, Hubbl, Foxtel Broadband, Kayo Sports and BINGE  
Special days away from work for Birthday, Cultural & Volunteer Leave  
Access to our holistic Fox Fit wellbeing program  
Generous ergonomics allowance for your WFH set up  
Company-wide meeting-free lunch hours and Friday afternoons  

A note to recruitment agencies - we have this role covered. There is no need to get in touch, we do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Overview

Microsoft ANZ is seeking a strategic and customer-focused leader to join the Sales Enablement and Operations team as the Business Program Manager.  Microsoft prides itself on attracting and retaining top talent across all levels of the organization. A key part of this success is ensuring that our subsidiaries are empowered with the insights and tools needed to drive local execution of global strategies.

Do you enjoy using your analytical and problem-solving skills to uncover insights and influence business outcomes? Are you passionate about enabling data-driven decisions that support operational excellence and strategic alignment? We are looking for a Business Analyst to support the ANZ subsidiary in delivering on these goals.

Responsibilities

As a BPM you will play a critical role in supporting the subsidiary’s business planning, performance tracking, and operational execution. You’ll partner closely with local and regional stakeholders to deliver insights that guide decision-making, optimize resource allocation, and align with Microsoft’s broader go-to-market strategy. This role is essential in enabling the subsidiary to execute with agility and precision, using data to drive impact.

The ideal candidate will be a strong collaborator, with exceptional communication and executive presence.

Own the holistic and forward thinking data and analytics roadmap and strategy for the program team and ensure it aligns with the broader subsidiary data strategy, including assessing when to use PowerBI or other tools to most effectively delivery

Implement the data strategy and own the accompanying internal analyses and tools; identify opportunities to improve outside of the current line of sight

Innovate and create next-generation tools, dashboards, and insights to enhance business efficiency and inform strategic decisions

Translate findings into succinct, actionable business insights, often in coordination with Sales Excellence Managers who help you tell a holistic story

Communicate results effectively for impact and provide follow-up insights in a timely manner

Collaborate with sales, marketing, and operations teams to identify opportunities for growth and efficiency.

Contribute to the development and execution of local strategies aligned with Microsoft’s global priorities

Embody our cultures and values

Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field or equivalent experience.

This position requires verification of Australian citizenship due to citizenship-based legal restrictions applicable to the role and as a result, you will need to provide a valid passport to verify your citizenship.

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Finance, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field AND 2+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis.

Proficiency with Excel, PowerBI, Power Query, and Power Apps.

Statistical analysis skills and knowledge of statistical software (for example, SPSS or R), including the application of multivariate models 

Ability to use low code (e.g. SQL) to process large data

Ability to translate sometimes ambiguous requests and questions into testable hypotheses, conduct relevant analyses, and generate actionable insights from findings.

Basic project management skills, including ability to align expectations on project deliverables, drive progress toward key milestones, and identify risks and dependencies.

Familiarity with business planning cycles, performance metrics, and operational reporting.

Ability to manage multiple stakeholders and align on deliverables, timelines, and priorities.

This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Work with major Australian brands on innovative, market‑leading products in a high‑ambition, no‑nonsense and supportive culture, where your ideas are valued and your growth is actively supported.

WHAT WE DO

At Holocentric, we develop products that give organizations an asymmetric advantage by enabling faster, cheaper, and more robust operational, risk, and compliance decisions at scale. We are proud to have long-term partnerships with many iconic Australian brands across banking, airlines, utilities, universities, and government sectors. Backed by Constellation Software, a leading listed software company, we anticipate accelerated growth with new products and business models in the coming years.

WHAT IS IT LIKE WORKING IN OUR TEAM?

Join a motivated, practical team with bold yet realistic goals. We openly discuss priorities and focus on what matters most.

Collaboration is key: flat hierarchy, no politics, and every voice counts. Support, feedback, and coaching are standard. You’re never alone when challenges arise.

We celebrate all wins and embrace learning from mistakes. We prefer trying and failing over analysis paralysis to drive innovation.

We value doing right by colleagues and customers, with transparency and a no-nonsense attitude. We work hard to keep our promises.

WHAT YOU WILL BE WORKING ON

In the immediate future, you will be working as part of a new team consisting of driven analysts, designers, engineers, and testers. This team will work on a high-growth venture focused on helping organizations make critical, high-stakes decisions at a speed enabled by artificial intelligence. The venture will incorporate various elements including decision intelligence, decision governance, data fabric, and artificial intelligence technologies. This team will develop products using Lean Startup principles and Agile methodologies to ensure rapid iteration and responsiveness to customer needs.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We need a business analyst who can transform product vision into requirements so clear that delivery teams can build without hesitation. You'll be the critical link that determines whether our teams work efficiently and whether what we ship actually solves client problems.

The impact you'll make: Your specifications will determine whether six-figure projects succeed or fail. Poor requirements cost us client relationships and team velocity. By navigating ambiguous client needs and creating crystal-clear requirements, you'll be accountable for ensuring every sprint delivers real value. When you get it right, you multiply the effectiveness of 20+ people across delivery teams.

The reality: You'll be the main point of contact on one of our largest projects, working in a team with multiple stakeholders who have competing priorities across different technical teams. Sprint cycles are 2 weeks. You'll need to be brilliant at context-switching and maintaining quality under pressure.

WHAT YOU WILL OWN

Requirements & Delivery (70% of your time)

Write product and user requirements documents that engineers can implement with minimal clarification questions

Define and validate solutions through user testing and prototypes

Help create wireframes, flows, and specifications that eliminate ambiguity

Orchestrate alignment between client stakeholders, designers, architects, engineering and quality assurance teams

Review architecture designs and provide product perspective

Run continuous user validation throughout development cycles

Document business rules and data models that become the single source of truth

Use AI tools strategically to improve requirements quality and catch gaps

Cross-Team Collaboration & Client Partnership (20% of your time)

Navigate ambiguous client requests and extract clear, actionable requirements

Build trusted relationships with client stakeholders and internal teams

Translate between business language, design thinking, and technical constraints

Facilitate workshops and discussions that bring clarity to complex problems

Surface misalignments early and drive teams towards shared understanding

Planning & Performance (10% of your time)

Refine backlog and make defensible prioritization decisions

Apply AI tools to synthesize feedback and spot opportunities

ABOUT YOU

What Success Will Look Like

In your first few months, you'll be making an impact when you:

Help most sprints complete smoothly with minimal rework—we track this and typically see 80%+ success rates

Work through ambiguous client requests and turn them into validated solutions

Develop strong working relationships with key client and internal stakeholders

Create documentation that becomes a go-to reference for the team

People who thrive here:

Work effectively with autonomy, they identify what needs doing and do it

Welcome feedback and review as opportunities to strengthen their work

Enjoy the energy of coordinating across teams to achieve shared outcomes

Make clear decisions when needed, even when opinions differ

Have experience where their analysis directly impacted significant business outcomes

We move fast, give direct feedback, and encourage you to push back when something doesn't make sense. If that environment appeals to you, keep reading.

WHAT YOU BRING

Must-haves:

Senior collaboration capability: You thrive working across client teams, design, architecture, and engineering. You're the person everyone wants on complex projects because you bring clarity and alignment.

Clarity from chaos: You navigate ambiguous situations with confidence, asking the right questions to uncover what's really needed. You've done this many times before.

Writing excellence: You write requirements that rarely need clarification. Your documentation is famous for its clarity and becomes the reference point for entire projects.

User validation obsession: You reflexively test assumptions with users before building. You know how to run effective validation sessions.

Able to build technical fluency: You are able to understand architectural constraints and speak confidently with engineers. You can challenge technical decisions when they don't serve business outcomes.

Required Experience

4-6 years in business analysis, product analysis, or product management roles

Proven track record working with external clients and managing their expectations

Experience leading analysis on complex, multi-team initiatives

Strong experience collaborating with cross-functional delivery teams (design, engineering, architecture)

Australian Citizenship or Australian Permanent Residency

Your next step:

If you’re interested in joining the Holocentric team, please send your resume and a compelling cover letter via the “Apply Now” button.

Don't miss this chance to be part of a leading Australian software enterprise with big plans for our people and our business. 

Your journey begins here.

Job Title: Data Manager
Location: Perth, WA (Hybrid)
Employment Type: Full-Time

About the Role
My client is a well-established finance company looking for a Data Manager to lead their data function. This role is responsible for overseeing data operations, governance and reporting to ensure information is accurate, secure and available for decision-making. You will manage a small team, set standards for data quality and help the business get the most out of its data assets.

Responsibilities

Lead and mentor a team of data analysts and engineers.
Oversee data management, governance and compliance frameworks.
Manage data pipelines, storage and reporting environments.
Ensure data quality, consistency and accessibility across the organisation.
Partner with business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver solutions.
Drive improvements in reporting, dashboards and self-service analytics.
Document policies, processes and maintain system knowledge.

Skills & Experience

Proven experience managing data teams or leading a data function.
Strong SQL skills and understanding of relational databases.
Hands-on knowledge of data integration and reporting tools.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP or Azure).
Good understanding of data governance, compliance and security.
Excellent leadership, communication and stakeholder management skills.

What’s on Offer

Competitive salary package.
A leadership role with influence over data strategy and standards.
Opportunity to develop and grow a data function within the organisation.
Hybrid working environment with flexibility.
Professional development and training.

If you’re interested, please email thana@psgaus.com.au

The role: Program Evaluation Specialist

Location: Canberra

Start Date: January 2026

Engagement type: Labour hire

Contract Length: 6-months (possible extension)

Pay: $75 - $95 per hour + Super

Hours: Full time with hybrid model



Role Overview

One of our Federal government clients is seeking an experienced candidate to lead an evaluation ready process including development of clear and evidence-based program logic models. The role provides strategic advice on outcomes, theory of change, performance measures, and evaluation planning to ensure programs are coherent, measurable and aligned to the Agency's strategic direction.



Key Responsibilities:

Lead the development and implementation of program logic models and data matrices.
Translate complex policy objectives into clear causal pathways, articulating inputs, outputs, and intended short-, medium- and long-term outcomes.
Provide authoritative advice on program design, performance measures, risks and evaluation requirements.
Facilitate workshops with internal stakeholders to build shared understanding of program purpose, outcomes and delivery assumptions.
Ensure products including program logics align with Australian Government frameworks, Agency strategies, evidence bases, risk frameworks and evaluation standards.
Lead and contribute to the development of monitoring and evaluation plans, including indicators, data requirements and methodologies.
Build the capability and understanding of Agency staff in program logic and evaluation design.
Prepare high-quality briefs, presentations and reports.

Key Capabilities & Skills:

Demonstrated expertise in program logic, theory-based design and evaluation methodology.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to synthesise evidence and translate ambiguity into structured program models.
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills, including the ability to lead workshops and influence decision-making.
High-level written communications skills, with the ability to produce clear logic diagrams, frameworks, briefs and technical guidance.

The Ideal Candidate:

Our ideal candidate is a highly experienced program design professional. Have significant experience in program design, evaluation performance reporting or similar roles and have qualifications in public policy, evaluation, social sciences, economics or related fields.

Qualifications & Experience:

Public policy
Social sciences,
Economics or related fields

Eligibility: Candidates must be Australian citizens to be eligible to apply.


Benefits of Contracting with Randstad:

Access to benefits platforms with discounts at major retailers

3 weekly pay runs

Exclusive access to roles before they go to market

Employee assistance programme, including counselling services




If you would like to be considered for these roles, this is a great opportunity to tell Randstad about you. Please click "Apply Now" to submit your current resume.

At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Join a Queensland Government Department as a PMO Analyst, supporting a major procurement policy initiative through April 2026 (possible extension). Drive governance, reporting, and process improvement across diverse projects. Flexible part-time options, inclusive culture, and a chance to make a real impact on services for Queensland communities.




An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Portfolio Management Office Analyst to join a highly respected government department in Brisbane, supporting the implementation of a major procurement policy initiative through to April 2026, with the possibility of extension. This role is pivotal in ensuring the successful delivery of programs and projects by providing expert governance, insightful reporting, and analytical support across a diverse portfolio. You will be instrumental in driving the adoption of standardised tools, templates, and processes that underpin effective project management, while also championing continuous improvement and best practice. The organisation offers flexible part-time arrangements, a supportive and inclusive culture, and the chance to make a meaningful impact on services that benefit communities across Queensland. If you are passionate about making a difference through your expertise in PMO operations and thrive in an environment that values collaboration, diversity, and professional growth, this is the perfect role for you.

Play a key role in shaping the future of public sector procurement by supporting the delivery of high-impact programs aligned with strategic objectives.
Enjoy flexible working arrangements within a collaborative team environment that values diversity, equity, and inclusion at every level.
Contribute to initiatives that directly improve housing assistance, youth empowerment, infrastructure development, and community outcomes across Queensland.

What you'll do:

As a Portfolio Management Office Analyst based in Brisbane, you will play an integral part in supporting the establishment and ongoing success of a major government procurement policy implementation. Your day-to-day responsibilities will see you collaborating closely with program teams to embed best practice governance frameworks while developing innovative solutions for performance monitoring and risk management. You will take ownership of designing user-friendly tools and templates that streamline project initiation through to benefits realisation. By maintaining central registers for risks and issues as well as configuring digital platforms like Microsoft Project Online and Power BI dashboards, you will enable transparent reporting and data-driven decision-making. Your ability to deliver engaging training sessions ensures that all stakeholders are equipped with the knowledge needed to succeed. Through your efforts in preparing comprehensive status reports and facilitating continuous process improvements based on feedback from colleagues across the department, you will help drive positive change that supports both organisational goals and community outcomes.

Develop and implement robust governance frameworks for portfolio management office operations, including performance monitoring, risk management, tracking, and benefits realisation.
Support the creation and ongoing maintenance of a comprehensive three-year portfolio roadmap to ensure alignment with strategic procurement objectives.
Design, develop, and roll out standardised tools and templates for project initiation, risk management, reporting processes, gate reviews, and benefits realisation activities.
Maintain a centralised risk and issues register for the entire portfolio to ensure timely identification, tracking, escalation, and resolution of risks and issues as they arise.
Lead the development and implementation of benefits management frameworks and initial benefits realisation plans while tracking progress across all programs.
Configure Microsoft Project Online to establish a complete portfolio setup encompassing all relevant programs and projects for seamless oversight.
Create interactive Power BI dashboards that provide real-time insights into portfolio performance metrics for stakeholders at all levels.
Deliver training sessions and ongoing support to program and project teams on using standardised tools, risk management techniques, reporting protocols, and benefits realisation strategies.
Monitor the application of gate review processes across all projects to ensure consistent adherence to approved frameworks and standards.
Prepare detailed portfolio status reports highlighting progress updates, emerging risks or issues, key decisions required, and actionable recommendations for senior leadership.

What you bring:

To excel as a Portfolio Management Office Analyst in this forward-thinking government department, you will bring substantial experience gained from similar roles where your technical expertise was matched by your commitment to teamwork. Your background should include hands-on involvement with PMO operations-particularly within environments where public service values are paramount. You will have demonstrated proficiency with digital platforms such as Microsoft Project Online for scheduling tasks as well as Power BI for creating compelling dashboards that inform decision-making at all levels. Your familiarity with established methodologies like PRINCE2 or Agile ensures you can navigate complex portfolios efficiently while adhering to best practices. Beyond technical skills, your ability to communicate clearly-both verbally during training sessions or meetings-and through concise written reports will set you apart. You are known for your adaptability when faced with changing circumstances; your approach is always considerate of others' perspectives which helps foster an atmosphere where everyone feels valued. Experience supporting governance activities such as risk assessment or compliance monitoring further enhances your suitability for this position. If you have previously contributed towards benefits realisation planning or tracking initiatives-even better-as these capabilities are highly regarded by the team.

Demonstrated experience working within a PMO or project/portfolio management environment-ideally within government or public sector settings where collaboration is essential.
Proficiency in using project management software such as Microsoft Project Online alongside advanced skills in Power BI dashboard creation for effective data visualisation.
Comprehensive understanding of project management methodologies (such as PRINCE2 or Agile) as well as portfolio management frameworks (including P3O).
A proven track record supporting governance activities including reporting cycles, risk identification processes, issue escalation procedures, and compliance monitoring.
Experience implementing new project management tools or processes-including configuration tasks as well as delivering training or support to end users.
Strong analytical abilities enabling you to interpret complex data sets accurately while generating actionable insights through high-quality written reports.
Flexibility to adapt quickly when priorities shift or requirements evolve-demonstrating resilience under pressure without compromising attention to detail.
Excellent interpersonal communication skills allowing you to build trust-based relationships with colleagues from diverse backgrounds while fostering an inclusive team culture.
Ability to identify dependencies between projects or workstreams-proactively recommending practical solutions that mitigate potential risks or delays.
Exposure to benefits realisation frameworks with hands-on experience tracking progress against defined targets is highly desirable.

What's next:

Apply today by clicking on the link provided; we look forward to receiving your application soon.

Ad Text:
We are seeking a Senior Enterprise Investment Advisor to lead Coliban Water’s investment evaluation and cost estimation practices. You will be the authority on business case quality, investment evaluation frameworks, and cost estimation methodologies, ensuring that all investment proposals deliver value for money and align with strategic priorities. 

This role provides expert advice to the Executive Leadership Team, Enterprise Investment Committee, and Investment Review Committee, shaping investment decisions with evidence-based insights. You will lead a small team of investment analysts and cost estimators, champion rigorous evaluation practices, and build organisational capability in investment assessment and financial appraisal. 

 

Key Responsibilities: 

As our Senior Enterprise Investment Advisor, you’ll be accountable for: 

Lead and continuously improve the Investment Evaluation Framework, cost estimation methods, and business case standards. 

Provide authoritative advice on investment evaluation, strategic justification, and value for money. 

Oversee Investment Logic Mapping (ILM), multi-criteria analysis (MCA), economic appraisal, and whole-of-life costing. 

Ensure business cases are robust, defensible, and aligned with regulatory and organisational priorities. 

Coach and develop your team and stakeholders on best practice investment evaluation and cost estimation. 

Partner strategically with senior leaders to integrate evaluation outcomes into portfolio prioritisation and enterprise planning. 

 

About you: 

Extensive experience (8–10 years) in investment evaluation, cost estimation, and business case development. 

Strong leadership capability, with experience guiding high-performing analytical teams. 

Expert knowledge of ILM, MCA, economic appraisal, cost planning, and whole-of-life costing. 

Exceptional communication, stakeholder engagement, and influencing skills at senior executive levels. 

Experience in regulated industries, utilities, or infrastructure is highly desirable. 

 

Sound like you? We’d love to hear from you.  

 

Learn more in the position description 

 

Salary: 

The salary and conditions for this position will be as per the Coliban Water Enterprise Agreement 2021 Band 6 $142,905 - $152,323 plus super salary range will be offered to the successful candidate commensurate with their skills and experience.  

 

Enquiries: 

For further information please contact Bidita Rezwana on 0431173635 or via email at bidita.rezwana@coliban.com.au 

To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter by 22 January 2026. 

 

Why join us? 

At Coliban Water our people are on a mission to create a better life for our customers and communities – now and tomorrow.  

We love what we do and our location in the centre of a region that takes in 49 towns from Trentham to Echuca.  

Our commitment to inclusion means you’ll feel at home here no matter who you are, who you love, or what you stand for. As part of the team you receive a monthly accrued day off, time off over Christmas, the flexibility to shape your work to suit your lifestyle, and generous parental, carer and workplace study leave policies.  

At Coliban Water we balance a small team rhythm with the reach and resources of one of the largest Victorian regional urban water corporations. 

 

What are you waiting for? We’d love you to join us. 

 

Applicants will need to successfully complete all core training requirements in the expected timeframes and may be required to undertake a Police Check, Working with Children Check, Pre-Employment Medicals or Psychometric testing where applicable. Applicants may also be required to produce evidence of their Right to Work in Australia.  

We welcome applications from individuals of all abilities. We are committed to creating an accessible and inclusive workplace for everyone, including people with disabilities and diverse abilities. If you need any support during the application process or would like to discuss interview adjustments, please contact Bidita Rezwana. 

Please indicate any adjustments (administrative, environmental, or procedural) you may need to effectively participate in the recruitment process and/or carry out the requirements of the role you are applying for.  

Please note that applicants may be contacted prior to the closing date. Coliban Water will be unavailable during the Christmas shutdown period from 25 December 2025 to 4 January 2026

Location: Bendigo, Bendigo, Goldfields & Macedon Ranges VIC (Hybrid)
Category:
Strategy & Planning (Consulting & Strategy)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
The Senior Enterprise Portfolio Advisor is a senior strategic advisory role within the Enterprise Investment Management (EIM) team, reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Investment Management. The role is accountable for portfolio performance intelligence, enterprise investment advisory services and portfolio governance excellence across Coliban Water’s $180+ million annual investment program. 
 

Leading the Portfolio Performance & Advisory function (up to five direct reports), you will shape how Coliban Water measures investment performance, prioritises competing investments, realises benefits and delivers long-term value. You will provide independent, evidence-based advice to the Executive Leadership Team, Board, Enterprise Investment Committee (EIC) and Investment Review Committee (IRC), supporting strategic decision-making and enterprise transformation. 

This role acts as the critical bridge between investment strategy and delivery performance, serving as Coliban Water’s centre of excellence for portfolio analytics, investment prioritisation and strategic portfolio advisory. 

 

Key Responsibilities: 

As our Senior Enterprise Portfolio Advisor, you’ll be accountable for: 

Lead and continuously improve Coliban Water’s enterprise portfolio performance and intelligence framework 

Provide strategic advice on portfolio performance, benefits realisation, value delivery, risk and investment optimisation 

Lead enterprise-wide investment prioritisation processes and governance in line with the Investment Evaluation Framework 

Build strong strategic partnerships with Portfolio Owners and senior leaders across the organisation 

Oversee development of portfolio dashboards, analytics, executive reporting and performance insights 

Lead benefits realisation governance and provide assurance on return on investment and value delivery 

Provide portfolio-level risk intelligence, performance assurance and health assessments 

Integrate portfolio performance insights into strategic planning, investment roadmaps and long-term planning cycles 

Lead, coach and develop a high-performing portfolio advisory and analytics team 

Champion evidence-based decision-making, portfolio discipline and continuous improvement across the enterprise 

 

About you: 

You are a trusted senior advisor with strong analytical capability and a proven ability to influence executive decision-making. You bring: 

Extensive experience leading portfolio management, investment advisory or strategic analytics functions 

Deep expertise in portfolio performance management, investment prioritisation and benefits realisation 

Strong strategic business partnering skills with executive and senior stakeholders 

Exceptional communication skills, translating complex insights into clear strategic advice 

Proven people leadership capability, developing high-performing analytical and advisory teams 

Experience in regulated industries such as utilities, water, infrastructure or government is highly regarded. 

Sound like you? We’d love to hear from you.  

 

Learn more in the position description 

 

Salary: 

The salary and conditions for this position will be as per the Coliban Water Enterprise Agreement 2021 Band 6 $142,905 - $152,323 plus super salary range will be offered to the successful candidate commensurate with their skills and experience.  

 

Enquiries: 

For further information please contact Bidita Rezwana on 0431173635 or via email at bidita.rezwana@coliban.com.au 

To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter by 22 January 2026. 

 

Why join us? 

At Coliban Water our people are on a mission to create a better life for our customers and communities – now and tomorrow.  

We love what we do and our location in the centre of a region that takes in 49 towns from Trentham to Echuca.  

Our commitment to inclusion means you’ll feel at home here no matter who you are, who you love, or what you stand for. As part of the team you receive a monthly accrued day off, time off over Christmas, the flexibility to shape your work to suit your lifestyle, and generous parental, carer and workplace study leave policies.  

At Coliban Water we balance a small team rhythm with the reach and resources of one of the largest Victorian regional urban water corporations. 

What are you waiting for? We’d love you to join us.
